headline: EVP and Chief Marketing Officer
summary: Eliot Hamlisch serves as Executive Vice President and Chief Marketing Officer of AMC Entertainment Holdings, Inc., the world’s largest theatrical exhibition company and an industry leader in innovation and operational excellence.  In his role, Hamlisch is accountable for driving attendance and market share at AMC theatres, optimizing revenue, serving as the company’s principal customer advocate, and acting as custodian of the guest experience.  Prior to joining AMC, Hamlisch served as EVP, Loyalty and Revenue Optimization at Wyndham Hotels & Resorts, the world’s largest hotel franchising company with 9,000+ hotels across nearly 100 countries and 22 iconic brands.  His oversight spanned the company’s award-winning loyalty program (Wyndham Rewards), customer engagement, loyalty, credit card, partnerships, distribution and revenue management functions.  Previously, Hamlisch served as Wyndham’s head of Global Sales, generating more than $1 billion in annual revenue across the company’s worldwide hotel portfolio.  Earlier in his career, Hamlisch held progressive leadership roles in strategic planning, business development and customer engagement with Starwood Hotels & Resorts, Deloitte Consulting, and American Express.   Hamlisch graduated magna cum laude from Harvard University and received his Master’s in Business Administration from Harvard Business School.
organization_description_1: Recruited to lead full-funnel marketing for the world’s largest theatrical exhibitor, with oversight spanning six business units, including Brand Marketing (Film, F&B, and Theatre), Digital (Website, App, and Performance Marketing), Loyalty & Partnerships (Financial and Strategic), Creative Services, PR & Communications, and Guest Insights & Analytics. Accountable for driving traffic, optimizing revenue, and stimulating loyalty among movie-goers across ~950 theatres and ~10,500 screens globally.
organization_description_2: Promoted to lead newly created global team of ~250 direct plus dotted line reports, with oversight spanning customer engagement, loyalty, credit card, strategic partnerships, distribution and revenue management functions.  Responsible for maximizing revenue generation and guest lifetime value across Wyndham’s diverse portfolio of 22 iconic brands and 9,000 hotels.
organization_description_3: Drove the strategy, design, and execution of the award-winning Wyndham Rewards program and WR Visa Signature Card portfolio, with full end-to-end P&L responsibility. Mobilized a team of talented associates, setting strategic direction for CRM, Lifecycle Marketing, and Member Servicing to deliver personalized engagement that drove double-digit growth in new member enrollments and improved member occupancy. Delivered significant shareholder value via EBITDA contribution from the WR Visa Signature Card program and key partnerships.  Enhanced WR’s value proposition by pursuing, negotiating, and optimizing strategic alliances, including Travel+Leisure, Caesars Entertainment, Vacasa, Door Dash, Avis Budget, PGA TOUR, and Roush Fenway Racing, among others.  Ensured operational excellence via oversight of program operations and loyalty technology.
organization_title_4: Vice President, Head Of Global Sales
organization_description_4: Promoted after five months in Sales Innovation role to lead Wyndham’s 100+ team member Global Sales Organization, responsible for generating $1B+ in revenue into 8,000+ hotels, 700,000+ rooms, and 10M+ sq. feet of meeting/function space.
organization_description_5: Cultivated Wyndham’s long-term sales strategy and innovation agenda, directly supervising core sales functions including sales strategy, systems administration, data management and analytics, performance reporting, project management, communications and marketing.
organization_description_6: Led a sales strategy and operations group focused on delivering actionable insights, innovative thought leadership, and operational support to enhance performance and drive profitable growth across Starwood's North America hotel portfolio.
organization_description_7: Provided strategic advisory services to senior executives and their teams. Managed teams to drive growth and marketing strategies, operational effectiveness, business model innovation, and customer experience enhancement. Promoted from Senior Consultant to Manager after 18 months.
organization_title_8: Manager, OPEN Vertical Marketing & Business Development
organization_description_8: Designed and implemented targeted marketing campaigns and executed business development partnerships to attract and retain small business owners in historically difficult-to-penetrate industries. Developed and patented (U.S. Patent #7953627) a process to identify industry segments with highest potential for new customers in an effort to optimize acquisition efforts and lifetime customer value.
organization_description_9: Member of corporate strategy group reporting to CEO. Provided internal consulting services to senior management, led strategic growth and cost-containing initiatives, and drove business development efforts across business units.
